title: Can I have some thoughts on my art? - Quora

response.answer_text: It seems like you’ve got a great basis here. Your symmetry is good, you’re accurate in your proportions, and your line art is pretty consistent. I’m not personally capable of drawing, but I’ve been making other content (i.e: digital illustration, music, video, writing, etc.) I understand drawing, I’m just spatially inept. There will be other people that could more specifically critique you, however, I found a part of your writing particularly interesting and couldn’t help but want to reply: “I’m kinda in a weird place with my art right now, knowing I’m skilled for my age but still doubting my abilities.” This sentence sounds entirely too familiar. In fact, I’m pretty sure it’s a statement that enthusiastic artists repeat consistently. Every person I know who considers themselves an artist seems to get down on themselves, I do this a lot too. If you haven’t heard Ira Glass’ monologue in “Ira Glass on Storytelling (pt.3/4)”, sometimes referred to as “The Gap”, I highly recommend you watch it. It really has some great words that I feel like you could relate to. It’s important to acknowledge that you’re 14. You’re definitely better than I was at 14, and I’m sure you feel like there are people that are your age (or probably much older) that are exceedingly better than you. That is perfectly okay, you’re young and have time. The most important thing to keep in mind is that what separates good artists from not-so-good artists is patience. A well-known recording artist once told me that the only that separated his music from my music was time. He would consistently say this to aspirational artists. I feel like this applies to all sectors of work and all mediums. For you, it’s just a matter of time. My last bit for you: do a ton of work, take classes in high school that revolve around your artistic interests. The thing that puts you ahead is the fact that you’re already capable, and as a result, you can only get better from here. If you have any questions, there are always people out there that can answer them. I recommend Quora, obviously, but make sure you check out some reddit communities for artists. If you have any questions about art colleges, admissions, portfolios, and all that jazz, feel free to send me a message. Finally, best of luck to you ! You’ve got great potential, I assure you that. :)

It looks pretty good. It looks like you’re still developing your style and that’s okay, because your future art style(s) will be better than this one(no offense). It still depends on what you're trying to go for. If you're going for a realistic style, then keep on moving, my brother. You’re on the right path to realistic sketching. If you're going for cartoon, make the eyes bigger.
